Lethality in Baltimore neighborhoods

Exploring lethality rates in Baltimore neighborhoods by comparing fatal and non-fatal shootings.

Click here to open the map in a new window.

Homicides have fluctuated

But have generally remained high during the past 15 years

Homicides by shootings has risen

From 77% (203) of total homicides in 2000 to 87% (300) in 2015

Headshots are particularly lethal

Victims killed by headshot are up from 82 (40%) in 2000 to 186 (62%) in 2015

Multiple gunshot victims are up

Victims suffering from multiple gunshots is up from 127 (59%) in 2005 to 211 (70%) in 2015

Lethality rates across the United States

Baltimore is among the most lethal cities in the country. See how it compares to other major cities below.

Baltimore

2015 statistics

Non-fatal shootings: 300

Fatal shootings: 637

Fatal / non-fatal ratio: 0.47
